required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Volumetric Study of the Buttocks After Flap Augmentation in Buttocks Lifting
clinical_study.official_title: Retrospective Study of Volumetric Gluteal Region by Parasacral Perforator Flaps in Circuferential Body Lift

brief_summary.textblock: The development of bariatric surgery, its effectiveness and the reduction of complications are at the origin of massive weight loss, the corollary of which has been a clear increase in the demands of treatment of sequelae of weight loss.

primary_outcome.description: evaluate the gluteal volume after augmentation with a parasacral flap using a 3D camera between the preoperative and at 2 months after surgery and 3 months after surgery

secondary_outcome.description: Surgical complication during hospitalization, then 15 days after the operation and 1 month after the operation

intervention.intervention_name: gluteal augmentation with flap in circumferential body lift
intervention.description: classic circumferential bodylift surgery, using two differents well-known flaps for gluteal augmentation

study_pop.textblock: patients after massiv weight loss who come in toulouse or montpellier hospital to take care of slimming effects

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- 12 months minimum delay with bariatric surgery
- female, BMI<30kg/m2
- Age greater than or equal to 18 years
- Stable weight for more than 6 months
- lack of volume in gluetal region
- agree with clinical trial
Exclusion criteria:
- Patient under tutorship or curatorship
- Pregnancy or breastfeeding
- hemoglobinemia< 12g/dL
- Albuminemia<3,5g/dL
- active smoking more than 1 month before surgery
